other_tests.findings: Presence of islands of calcified cartilage within bone, consistent with impaired coupling of cartilage resorption with vascular invasion and ossification.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At age 15.4 yr, the biopsy showed normal vascular invasion and differentiation in the metaphyseal growth plate, indicating regression of earlier abnormalities.

other_tests.findings: Islands of hypertrophic chondrocytes surrounded by bone, without evidence of vascular invasion.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Comparative biopsy at age 15.4 yr showed no islands of hypertrophic chondrocytes, indicating resolution of earlier abnormalities.

other_tests.findings: Radiological resolution of opacities with normal bone density appearing subjacent to the growth plate.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Notable improvement following earlier findings at ages 9.5 and 11.4 yr with measured progression of metaphyseal dysplasia.

other_tests.findings: Progression of genu valgum deformity and metaphyseal abnormality.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At age 17 yr, repeat x-rays showed regression of the metaphyseal abnormalities.

other_tests.findings: Indications of previous abnormalities in the metaphysis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The biopsy at age 15.4 yr showed normal appearance, differing from earlier observations.

other_tests.findings: Initially aimed to correct lower limb deformity.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Did not halt the progression of deformity as intended.

other_tests.findings: IgG levels were initially more than 3 times the upper limit, decreased with time; IgM was mildly raised at 9.8 and 10.2 yr, normal at 16.9 yr.
other_tests.changes_over_time: IgG levels decreased from 46 g/liter at 9.8 yr to 22.6 g/liter at 16.9 yr.
